page.title: 11CROSSFORD SCHOOL (continued)
page.content: When the pupils move on to secondary education they go to Queen Anne High School in Dunfermline, unless they are Roman Catholic, as then they will move on to St. Columba's High School, also in Dunfermline. Crossford School has an unusual design, the junior rooms, partly open plan, leading off from a central circular hall where meetings and indoor P.E. can take place. This hall is linked by a corridor, off which lie the administration rooms, to a smaller semi-circular area which gives access to the infant rooms. The building is surrounded by playgrounds, with a large playing field, but some of this land has had to be used for a portable classroom to house one class. In the evenings the building is used for adult education classes, P.T.A. meetings etc.
